workflow.tool_output:
Synthesis of N-(4-butoxyphenyl)acetamide (1l)

Reagents and Stoichiometry  
• 4-Bromoacetanilide (CAS 122-51-0): 214 mg (1.00 mmol, 1.00 equiv)  
• n-Butanol (≥99%, CAS 71-36-3): 89 mg (1.20 mmol, 1.20 equiv)  

Procedure  
1. Charge a dry reaction vial under inert atmosphere with 4-bromoacetanilide (214 mg, 1.00 mmol) and n-butanol (89 mg, 1.20 mmol).  
2. Subject the mixture to the conditions of “Modification A” of the General Procedure (as defined in the original publication).  
3. Upon completion of the reaction, purify the crude mixture by “workup procedure A.”  

Isolation and Purification  
• Chromatography on silica gel; eluent gradient 0 → 100 % dichloromethane in hexanes.  
• Product obtained as a brown solid.  

Yields  
Run 1: 137 mg (66 %)  
Run 2: 144 mg (70 %)  
Average yield: 68 %

workflow.tool_output:
Synthesis of N-(4-butoxyphenyl)acetamide (1l)

Reagents and Stoichiometry (1.00 mmol scale)  
• 4-Bromoacetanilide (214 mg, 1.00 mmol, 1.0 equiv)  
• n-Butanol (89 mg, 1.20 mmol, 1.2 equiv)  
• Sodium tert-butoxide (NaOt-Bu, 192 mg, 2.00 mmol, 2.0 equiv)  
• Ligand L8 (102.6 mg, 0.20 mmol, 20 mol %)  
• Copper(I) iodide (CuI, 19.0 mg, 0.10 mmol, 10 mol %)  
• Anhydrous dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO, 2.0 mL)

Procedure (Modification A of the General Coupling Procedure)  
1. In a nitrogen-filled glovebox, flame-dry or oven-dry a 16 × 125 mm reaction tube fitted with a Teflon-coated magnetic stir bar.  
2. Charge the tube with sodium tert-butoxide (192 mg), ligand L8 (102.6 mg), and copper(I) iodide (19.0 mg).  
3. Add anhydrous DMSO (2.0 mL) by syringe, stir the resulting dark-maroon solution for 10 min.  
4. Add 4-bromoacetanilide (214 mg) and then n-butanol (89 mg) directly to the reaction mixture.  
5. Cap the tube with a Teflon-lined septum, remove from the glovebox, and place in an oil bath preheated to 40 °C.  
6. Stir at 40 °C for 16 h.

Workup Procedure A  
1. After 16 h, open the tube to air and transfer its contents to a separatory funnel, rinsing with H₂O and/or EtOAc.  
2. Add saturated aqueous NaCl (brine, 20 mL) and diethyl ether (25 mL), shake, and allow phase separation.  
3. Separate the organic layer and extract the aqueous phase with diethyl ether (2 × 25 mL).  
4. Combine the organic extracts, dry over Na₂SO₄, filter, and concentrate under reduced pressure.  
5. Purify the crude residue by flash chromatography on silica gel (SNAP cartridge, 25 g) using a gradient of 0 → 100 % CH₂Cl₂ in hexanes, monitoring by UV (254 and 280 nm).  
6. Combine product-containing fractions, concentrate in vacuo, and dry under high vacuum overnight.  
7. If residual solvent persists, dissolve the material in heptane, concentrate, redissolve in minimal diethyl ether, and dry under high vacuum for an additional 3 h to obtain N-(4-butoxyphenyl)acetamide as a brown solid.

workflow.tool_output:
Synthesis of N-(4-butoxyphenyl)acetamide (1l)

Reagents (1.00 mmol scale)  
• 4-Bromoacetanilide (214 mg, 1.00 mmol, 1.0 equiv)  
• n-Butanol (1.20 equiv, 89 mg, 1.20 mmol)  
• Sodium tert-butoxide (NaOt-Bu, 192 mg, 2.00 mmol, 2.0 equiv)  
• N1,N2-Bis(2-phenylnaphthalen-1-yl)benzene-1,2-diamine (Ligand L8, 102.6 mg, 0.20 mmol, 20 mol %)  
• Copper(I) iodide (CuI, 19.0 mg, 0.10 mmol, 10 mol %)  
• Anhydrous dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO, 2.0 mL)

Procedure (Modification A of the General Coupling Procedure)  
1. Oven-dry a 16 × 125 mm glass reaction tube equipped with a Teflon-coated magnetic stir bar; cool under N₂ or in a glovebox.  
2. Charge the tube with sodium tert-butoxide, Ligand L8, and copper(I) iodide.  
3. Add anhydrous DMSO (2.0 mL) by syringe and stir inside the glovebox (or under N₂) for 10 min; the solution will turn dark maroon.  
4. Add 4-bromoacetanilide (214 mg) and then n-butanol (89 mg) directly to the reaction mixture.  
5. Seal the tube with a Teflon-lined septum, remove from the glovebox (if used), and immerse in an oil bath pre-heated to 40 °C.  
6. Stir at 40 °C for 16 h.

Workup Procedure A  
1. After 16 h, open the tube to air and transfer the contents to a separatory funnel, rinsing the tube with water and/or ethyl acetate.  
2. Add saturated aqueous sodium chloride (20 mL) and diethyl ether (25 mL), shake, and allow the layers to separate.  
3. Collect the organic layer and extract the aqueous phase with diethyl ether (2 × 25 mL).  
4. Combine the organic extracts, dry over sodium sulfate, filter, and concentrate under reduced pressure.  
5. Purify the crude residue by flash chromatography on silica gel (25 g SNAP cartridge) using a gradient from 0 % to 100 % dichloromethane in hexanes.  
6. Combine the fractions containing product, concentrate in vacuo, and dry under high vacuum overnight.  
7. If DMSO or other solvent remains, dissolve the solid in heptane, concentrate, then redissolve in minimal diethyl ether and dry under high vacuum for an additional 3 h.

workflow.content: Extraction complete. The procedure and workup are fully self-contained with all reagents (including Ligand L8 defined), conditions, and steps specified. No unresolved cross-references remain. Recommend manager terminate the workflow.

summary:
Workflow summary:
- Parsed and chunked the source text (Segment).
- Retrieved product candidates (Product_Collect) and a close analog (Similarity).
- Extracted full procedures with workup (Retrieval_Procedure).
- Evaluations selected “General Procedure (Modification A)” and “Ligand L8.”

Final conclusion:
The likely procedure follows the copper-catalyzed O-arylation exemplified by N-(4-butoxyphenyl)acetamide: 4-bromoacetanilide, alcohol, NaOt-Bu, CuI (10 mol%), Ligand L8 (20 mol%) in anhydrous DMSO, 40 °C, 16 h, followed by Workup A and silica purification. This serves as the proposed method for the target structure. Step 9 (final evaluation) is pending.
